bio:treatment.discussion: Variety argus occurs in the Siskiyou/Trinity mountains of Josephine and Jackson counties, Oregon, and in Del Norte, Glenn, Humboldt, Plumas, Siskiyou, and Trinity counties, California. It is the serpentine counterpart to var. furcosum of volcanic and granitic soils in the Sierra Nevada, but is more elegant and much more attractive. The inflorescences are nearly always compound, and the flowering stem frequently has a single leaflike bract about midlength. Based on the latter feature, the one-eyed sulphur flower is probably more closely related to var. bahiiforme than it is to var. furcosum.
